Class SokobanGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • SokobanGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    public class SokobanGUI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    A Graphical User Interface (GUI) for the Sokoban puzzle game.
    Version:
    March 2022
    Author:
    Scott Cumming (ID 21056374)

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SokobanGUI()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Resets the game to the start of the level.
      void createGameBoard()
      Creates a JPanel in Gridlayout to represent the Sokoban board and assigns a GameCell object to each cell.
      void createPopUp()
      Creates a popup with instructions on how to play the game, which can be accessed from a menu item.
      void exit()
      Closes the game and the application.
      int getCols()
      Gets the total number of columns in the current level of the game.
      Cell getMatchingCell​(int r, int c)
      Gets the cell in the Sokoban model that corresponds to the cell in the gameboard.
      java.lang.String getPossibleMoves()
      Checks where the actor can move to next.
      int getRows()
      Gets the total number of rows in the current level of the game.
      void load()
      Loads a saved game from a text file selected by the user.
      void loadLevel()
      Creates the Sokoban game and the JFrame containing the GUI components for a given level.
      (package private) void move​(Direction dir)
      Moves the actor to a valid cell and loads the next level if the move completes the current level.
      boolean possibleMove​(Direction d)
      Checks whether a move is valid.
      void save()
      Saves the current game to the text file already created.
      void saveAs()
      Saves the current game to a new text file created by the user.
      (package private) void setStatusBar​(java.lang.String s)
      Adds a given string to the status bar for 3 seconds.
      void undo()
      Undoes the last move made by the user.
      void update​(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      Updates the GameCells in the gameboard when the matching cells in the Sokoban model change.

      • getMatchingCell

        public Cell getMatchingCell​(int r,
                            int c)
        Gets the cell in the Sokoban model that corresponds to the cell in the gameboard.
        Parameters:
        r - the row number of a cell in the gameboard.
        c - the column number of a cell in the gameboard.
        Returns:
        the matching cell in the Sokoban model.

      • move

        void move​(Direction dir)
        Moves the actor to a valid cell and loads the next level if the move completes the current level.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to move the actor.

      • possibleMove

        public boolean possibleMove​(Direction d)
        Checks whether a move is valid.
        Parameters:
        d - the direction to be checked.
        Returns:
        a boolean value stating whether the move is valid.

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.lang.String getPossibleMoves()
        Checks where the actor can move to next.
        Returns:
        all possible directions in a String.

      • update

        public void update​(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Updates the GameCells in the gameboard when the matching cells in the Sokoban model change.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - the observable.
        arg - the cell in the model which changed.

        Adds a given string to the status bar for 3 seconds.
        Parameters:
